resources.string: Apertium offers both text translation, along with the translation of documents and surf and translate.
The application has crashed during last run with error [%1$s].\n\n Please tell us about it at %2$s .
Are you sure want to remove this package?
This is not a valid JAR package!
There is no language direction from %1$s to %2$s
Download and Install directly from internet
Widgets such as shortcut for specific language

This app is a free, open source, offline machine translation app which offers most of the language directions from Apertium.
Apertium is a rule based, open source, machine translation project and platform. Apertium can, like this app, be installed on your own machine. That means that you don\'t need en internet connection and you don\'t need to send confidential tekst through the internet to get a translation. If you want to quickly try it out there are zero-install Java web start applets

Need help creating your own offline translation service?

There is a lively voluntarily driven community, ready to help developers and end users. Please see http://wiki.apertium.org for how to get in touch. Commercial services for special needs, like machine translation for specific domains are also offered.

Developer info

Want to make your own offline translation service?

This app is an open source showcase of how to do offline translation. We encourage you to copy it and modify as you like.

Something missing? Want to make your own language pair?

It takes around 3 months of full time work to create a language pair from scratch. We at Apertium will help you, of course, and if you are a student you could consider engaging in Apertium work being sponsored by the Google Summer of Code open souce program Google Summer of Code™ (GSoC) has brought together thousands of students with hundrets of open source projects to create millions of lines of code. In short the deal is that if you apply for GSoC and work for us making a language pair or other imrovements to Apertium, then Google will send a check with around 5000$ in your direction.

Authors and contributors

This app would not haved been possible without the support of GSoC stipends.
